intro: Bistorta suffulta subsp. suffulta, commonly known as the tall bistort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, clustered stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces showy, pinkish-red flowers in late summer, which are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. This species is often found in moist meadows, stream sides, and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
